definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to wear a hat/(fig.) to stigmatize/to be branded as
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
tall conical paper hat worn as a public humiliation/dunce cap/(fig.) flattery
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation
(coll.) to be the object of flattery/to be placed on a pedestal
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
a cuckold/to be cuckolded by one's wife

sentences.english: The cap passes close word, can accelerate the rate of trichomadesis.
sentences.chinese: 帽子过紧的话，会加快脱发的速度。

sentences.english: The lady is trying on a fashionable hat.
sentences.chinese: 那位女士正在试戴一顶时髦的帽子。

sentences.english: He cocked his hat and twirled his stick.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子，挥舞着手杖。

sentences.english: A man was sitting at a corner, with a hat in each hand, waiting for handouts.
sentences.chinese: 一个人坐在墙角处，两手各托一顶帽子，乞求施舍。

sentences.english: The conjurer waved his magic wand and pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师挥舞魔杖，从帽子里拉出一只兔子。

sentences.english: How do you like the hat which Grace has on today?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得葛雷丝今天戴的帽子如何？

sentences.english: The woman with a large hat on her head is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 冠词，顾名思义，就是戴在名词头上的一顶帽子。

sentences.english: To doff one's hat . Some men's hat is easily blow away as their head.
sentences.chinese: 有些人的帽子，就象他们的脑子一样，很容易被吹走。

sentences.english: He persists in wearing that old-fashioned hat.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持要戴那顶旧帽子。

sentences.english: The man cocked his hat in the latest fashion.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人按照最近时兴的方式歪戴着帽子。

sentences.english: He discarded an old hat and an old pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他扔掉了一顶旧帽子和一双旧鞋。

sentences.english: I hope Mr. Bingley will like it, Lizzy.
sentences.chinese: 我希看彬格莱先生会喜欢你这顶帽子，丽萃。

sentences.english: The boy has got his hat on crooked.
sentences.chinese: 这个小男孩把帽子歪戴。

sentences.english: This hat is so expensive that I can't afford it.
sentences.chinese: 这顶帽子贵得也太离谱了，我买不起。

sentences.english: The camel is going to eat the flower on the girl's hat.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼将要吃女孩帽子上的那朵花。

sentences.english: The nice hat is my sister's.
sentences.chinese: 那个漂亮的帽子是我妹妹的。

definition: to wear a hat/(fig.) to stigmatize/to be branded as
cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
